conclusion: To ensure the bubble is not visible, paper must cover areas where rays can emerge.
The bubble is at the center of the cube, distance d = a/2 from each face.
Rays that reach the face with an incident angle <= critical angle θc can emerge.
Locus of emergence points satisfying θ = θc is a circle of radius r = (a/2) tan θc.
For glass with refractive index n = 1.5, sin θc = 1/n = 2/3.
Calculate area A = π r² = π (a²/4) (4/5) = π a² /5.
Minimum area of each paper patch is A_min = (π/5) a².
